author: sky.cactus
content: One could imagine us removing receipts and log bloom from consensus (if we ignore the stateless/light client problem) but retaining the `LOG` opcodes.  Individual clients could surface `LOG` opcode calls however they wanted, or even no-op them internally.  We could have a separate optional (not consensus) standard for the JSON-RPC and subscribing to LOG calls and/or storing them/making them available.

author: sky.cactus
content: TL;DR: Keep the opcode, make it a no-op for consensus but an op practically for most clients.

author: sky.cactus
content: One can imagine running a version/configuration of a client that completely no-ops them if you don't need to ever notice events.

author: sky.cactus
content: This doesn't solve the stateless/light client problem though.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: IMO dapps shouldn’t be building on top of unverifiable constructs (isn’t that one of the main knocks against most of the JSONRPC API?) so I’d be strongly in favor of keeping the logs in the receipts just removing the bloom from the header.  Or moving the logs elsewhere but making them provable/part of consensus.
